intro: Carex humahuacaensis, commonly known as the Humahuaca sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. This species is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous areas. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
